intro: Laurentia tenella, commonly known as the narrowleaf laurentia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense, terminal spikes and produce tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Laurentia tenella typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
